title: CEO Secrets: 'In my business, you eat what you kill'
description: Music executive Riki Bleau shares his business advice for our CEO Secrets series.

title: Ros Atkins on... the UK's rising energy bills
description: Ros Atkins asks where the pressure began on the UK's energy industry.

title: Life at 50C: Heat hitting home in Australia
description: Cities like Sydney are already experiencing extremely hot days because of climate change.

title: PPE hospital masks find new life fighting plastic waste
description: All schools and colleges in Cornwall will be given litter pickers made from old hospital masks.

title: Dan James: Leeds winger plays in Carabao Cup win at Fulham after becoming a dad
description: Tuesday 21 September 2021 is a day Daniel James will never forget after the birth of his baby boy and playing for Leeds in Carabao Cup win at Fulham.

title: Ryder Cup: Tales behind Great Britain's wins over the United States
description: Britain only defeated the US three times in the first 25 Ryder Cups, but behind each victory is a wealth of remarkable stories.

title: Covid vaccine stockpiles: Could 241m doses go to waste?
description: Joe Biden wants more global vaccine equality but the US and other nations have not backed promises with action.

title: Museum of the Year: Colchester gallery Firstsite wins £100,000 prize
description: Alongside top exhibitions, its café became a canteen offering free school meals during the pandemic.

title: Abba's Bjorn Ulvaeus launches campaign to fix £500m music royalty problem
description: Bjorn Ulvaeus launches a campaign to ensure musicians don't miss out on unpaid royalties.

title: Afghanistan: 'I feel betrayed. We feel left behind'
description: An Afghan interpreter affected by an email data breach at the MoD says he feels betrayed by the UK.

title: Where does the UK get its gas and is it facing a shortage this winter?
description: A surge in gas prices has prompted fears of hard times ahead - but how bad could it get?

title: Afghanistan: MoD refers itself to Information Commissioner over data breach
description: More than 250 people seeking relocation to the UK - many in hiding - were mistakenly copied into an email.

title: Gas price crisis: Government poised to step in, says Kwarteng
description: The government is likely to help big gas providers forced to take customers from failed firms.

title: Russia behind Litvinenko murder, says court
description: The former Russian spy, who became a British citizen, was poisoned in London with polonium in 2006.

title: Salisbury poisonings: Third man faces charges for Novichok attack
description: Denis Sergeev is thought to have been the on-the-ground commander for the 2018 poisonings.

title: Steve Cooper: Nottingham Forest appoint ex-Swansea City boss after agreeing compensation
description: Nottingham Forest appoint Steve Cooper as head coach after they agree compensation with former club Swansea City.

title: The night my baby died as I gave birth in prison
description: Louise Powell says her baby died "due to errors" made after she went into labour in prison.

title: Children face 'agonising' waits for mental health care
description: BBC investigation finds children in England face 'agonising' waits in pandemic to access services.

title: Government borrowing higher than expected in August
description: Borrowing was lower than a year earlier, but was still the second-highest on record for August.

title: Harry Dunn: Liz Truss raises case with US at United Nations Assembly
description: Foreign Secretary Liz Truss speaks to the US Secretary of State about "delivering justice".

title: Migrants in Texas: US probes horseback charge on Haiti migrants
description: Images which seem to show border agents on horseback driving migrants back spark an investigation.

title: Vunipolas and Ford dropped as England coach Jones calls up Lynagh
description: Billy and Mako Vunipola plus George Ford are left out of a 45-man training squad as eight uncapped players including Louis Lynagh are called up.

title: NFL: Aaron Jones scores four TD's for Green Bay against Detroit Lions
description: Running back Aaron Jones scores four touchdown for the Green Bay Packers as they beat divisional rivals the Detroit Lions 35-17.

title: Lady Marmalade singer Sarah Dash, of the group Labelle, dies at 76
description: Dash was a co-founder of the rock/R&B group Labelle, best known for their 1975 hit Lady Marmalade.

title: Jones loses father's ashes while scoring touchdown
description: Aaron Jones honours his late father by scoring four touchdowns as the Green Bay Packers beat the Detroit Lions.

title: Canada election: Trudeau stays in power but Liberals fall short of majority
description: His Liberal Party retains power but he fails to secure the majority he wanted when calling the snap election.

title: World War Two: The brothers who fled Nazi occupation by kayak
description: The "Engelandvaarders" who paddled from the Netherlands to England 80 years ago.

title: Newspaper headlines: Gas crisis 'spirals' as 'dozens of firms set to collapse'
description: Continuing concerns over soaring gas prices dominate Tuesday's newspaper front pages.

title: The torso in the Thames: A 20-year mystery
description: Twenty years ago, a young African boy was murdered and his torso was dumped in the Thames. It's the longest unsolved child murder case in the recent history of the Metropolitan Police.

title: Nasa selects landing site for Moon rover mission
description: The space agency will send a rover to look for water-ice near a crater at the Moon's South Pole.

title: The mother and son who waited 58 years for a hug
description: Calvin Barrett flies from the US to the UK to meet his "Ma" after tracing her through a DNA test.

title: Climate reporting reaches melting point
description: A trip to a melting glacier will shape how the BBC's new climate editor reports on climate change.
